pageContext.claim: “During the Obama years, that's all I heard about: War with North Korea. You have 28 million people, 30 miles away from the border where they have thousands of massive -- they call them "cannons." And that's what they are. They're bigger than howitzers. And they're all aimed at Seoul. Seoul has 28 million people. And it would be not a catastrophe of 100,000 people or 200,000, like I'd read from you. This was a -- this could have been a catastrophe of 30-, 40-, 50 million people. And I think we're very close to having that situation solved.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump exaggerates the North Korean nuclear threat during Barack Obama's administration, exaggerates the number of potential casualties, and exaggerates his accomplishments by saying he's very close to solving the situation. According to the Congressional Research Service, “an escalation of a military conflict on the peninsula could affect upwards of 25 million people on either side of the border.”
